abstract: A representation of element, attribute-list, entity, and notation declarations in a Document Type Definition.
overview:
## Overview

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] objects are the sole children of a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTD] object (possibly along with comment nodes and processing-instruction nodes). They themselves cannot have any children.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] objects can be of four kinds—element, attribute-list, entity, or notation declaration—and can also be of a subkind, as specified by a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/DTDKind-swift.enum] constant. For example, a DTD entity-declaration node could represent an unparsed entity declaration ([doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/DTDKind-swift.enum/unparsed]) rather than a parameter entity declaration ([doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/DTDKind-swift.enum/parameter]). You can use a DTD node’s subkind to help determine how to handle the value of the node.

You can create an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] object with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/init(xmlString:)] method, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode] class method [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/dtdNode(withXMLString:)], or with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode] initializer [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/init(kind:options:)] (in the latter method supplying the appropriate [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/Kind-swift.enum] constant).

Setting the object value or string value of an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] objects affects different parts of different kinds of declaration. See the related programming topic for more information.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode
crawled: 2025-12-03T18:24:11Z

# XMLDTDNode

**Class**

A representation of element, attribute-list, entity, and notation declarations in a Document Type Definition.

## Declaration

```swift
class XMLDTDNode
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] objects are the sole children of a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTD] object (possibly along with comment nodes and processing-instruction nodes). They themselves cannot have any children.

[doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] objects can be of four kinds—element, attribute-list, entity, or notation declaration—and can also be of a subkind, as specified by a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/DTDKind-swift.enum] constant. For example, a DTD entity-declaration node could represent an unparsed entity declaration ([doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/DTDKind-swift.enum/unparsed]) rather than a parameter entity declaration ([doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/DTDKind-swift.enum/parameter]). You can use a DTD node’s subkind to help determine how to handle the value of the node.

You can create an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] object with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode/init(xmlString:)] method, the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode] class method [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/dtdNode(withXMLString:)], or with the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode] initializer [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/init(kind:options:)] (in the latter method supplying the appropriate [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLNode/Kind-swift.enum] constant).

Setting the object value or string value of an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/XMLDTDNode] objects affects different parts of different kinds of declaration. See the related programming topic for more information.

## Initializing an NSXMLDTDNode Object

- **init(xmlString:)**: Returns an `NSXMLDTDNode` object initialized with the DTD declaration in a given string.

## Managing the DTD Node Kind

- **dtdKind**: Returns the receiver’s DTD kind.

## Managing DTD Identifiers

- **isExternal**
- **notationName**: Returns the name of the notation associated with the receiver.
- **publicID**: Returns the public identifier associated with the receiver.
- **systemID**: Returns the system identifier associated with the receiver.

## Constants

- **XMLDTDNode.DTDKind**: The type defined for the constants that specify the kind and subkind of DTD declaration represented by an `NSXMLDTDNode` object. You set the DTD-node kind using the doc:nsxmldtdnode/1806486-setdtdkind method.
- **DTD Node Kind Constants**: Constants that specify the kind and subkind of DTD declaration represented by an `NSXMLDTDNode` object. You set the DTD-node kind using the doc:nsxmldtdnode/1806486-setdtdkind method.

## Initializers

- **init()**
- **init(kind:options:)**

## Tree-Based Processing

- **XMLDTD**: A representation of a Document Type Definition.
- **XMLDocument**: An XML document as internalized into a logical tree structure.
- **XMLElement**: The element nodes in an XML tree structure.
- **XMLNode**: The nodes in the abstract, logical tree structure that represents an XML document.

## Inherits From

- XMLNode

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
